data.title: Fix PacketPeerUDP get_packet_port()
data.body: Properly convert port field from network to system ordering on incoming packets.

data.title: Renamed playback/speed to playback/speed_scale
data.body:
Also corrected a typo in the respective documentation

Closes #2060

data.title: detach/clear script context menu option
data.body:
I got reminded a few minutes ago that for people starting out in Godot is really difficult to figure out how to detach/clear scripts from nodes. It's intuitive to attach, but not to detach, myself included. When I first looked at Godot I just couldn't figure out how the heck to do it cause it isn't specified anywhere that attaching scripts basically just sets the `Script` property in `Inspector`.

I propose that a `Detach Script` near `Add Script` in the context menu :).

data.title: Latest commit breaks debugging
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS 10.12 (Sierra) - Godot-master c67e3a485dedae96b82c3356d5f45ab0509d7759

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
This commit somehow broke debugging: when playtesting, nothing gets printed in the console and nothing gets shown in the debug window.

I had to revert to the commit before this one in order to get debugging working again.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just play test _any_ scene.

data.title: Coding standards: Headers
Add Scots (lang code "sco") as a supported language in Godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - Godot 2.1 Stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I tried to add my Scots translation of a game into my project, and it didn't recognize it, nor does it officially support.

Can this language be added to the list in 2.1.1. or whatever next version comes out?

data.title: Allow typing hints for Array class (in GDScript and Inspector)
data.body:
Closes #3586, by implementing the `1b` variation mentioned there.

Use as:

``` gdscript
export(Array, IntArray) var map
export(Array, Array, int, FLAGS, "Walkable", "Mineable") var map
```

data.title: Mouse Cursor lag
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1

I've searched this repo but cannot find anything related to the cursor lag

However, I found this:
https://godotengine.org/qa/6572/is-it-possible-to-run-custom-mouse-cursor-in-seperate-thread

> Custom mouse cursors are emulated by Godot as a sprite on top of the scene, that's why they are affected by lag. According to this issue, custom mouse pointers will be rewritten in 3.0 so they use the system's API instead, then I guess they won't be affected by lag anymore.

Real life example:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/334d7c3fc523cbf51452d2edaccac16c.gif)

And that's changing the position of the sprite using `_input`, inside a `CanvasLayer`.  Is there maybe an alternative method we can use before waiting for 3.0? (If it's even noted :P) This is essential for Hotline Miami / top down shooters. The lag really makes a difference in fluidity / combat

data.title: make Container node aware of Size Flags
data.body: It really bugged me that all of the `Container` subclasses are capable of using children `Control` `Size Flags` but not `Container` itself. I submitted a patch to make `Container` aware of these flags as well... this seems logical to me :)

data.title: Hints comments
data.body:
A specific character (? by example) could be used just after # in a declaration for identify a hint comment.
It would contain a type information and could be used for the completion and the preventive error detection (and probably more).

``` python
func f(a, b, c, d): #? int, String, *, SomeClass.gd : Rect2
    return Rect2()

func g(): #? void : null
    var a #? int # a meaningful integer
    return true # no error but a warning 'return type mismatch'

func h():
    # f() returns a Rect2, it can be completed
    var a = f().|

    # warning 'found Rect2, String expected'
    var b = f() #? String
```

data.title: continuous collision detection method cast ray leads to incorrect results
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Switching between different ccd modes changes the results of the solver. A collision is correctly reported, but the resulting speed of the involved rigid body is completely wrong.
In the project I linked a ball moves towards a vertical rectangle in a diagonal direction. After the collision the horizontal movement is reflected (correct), but the vertical is also reflected, resulting in the ball going back in the direction it came from.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a RigidBody and put it on a path that collides with a StaticBody in an angle. 
Set a speed that is large enough for ccd to be applied.
Set friction and gravity scale to 0 and bounce to 1 on both bodies.
Set Continuous CD to Cast Ray.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[issue_cast_ray.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/552709/issue_cast_ray.zip)

data.title: Adding IPv6 support
data.body:
From what I read on IRC it should be more or less ready to merge into master now.

CC @punto- and @Faless for confirmation.

data.title: Pass correct address size (ipv4,ipv6) to socket connect, bind, sendto
data.body:
The address size passed to network system calls now reflects the the actual IP type (v4 or v6).
Fix Windows and OSX ipv6 sockets

data.title: Possible bug? Tween won't animate all if 'set_repeat" is unchecked.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot Engine 2.2 on Windows 7 64bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When stacking animations with interpolate_method, for the same method in the same object, only the first animation is actuated.
I'm getting that issue on 2.2 but it works fine in 2.1 stable.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a Sprite (for instance)
Create new Tween
In code write:

```
tween.interpolate_method(sprite, "set_scale", from, to, 1, tween.TRANS_LINEAR, t.EASE_IN)
tween.interpolate_method(sprite, "set_scale", to, from, 1, tween.TRANS_LINEAR, t.EASE_IN, 1) <- set delay 
tween.set_repeat(false)
tween.start
```

Run the project
Watch it won't scale back to initial scale

Now pass True to set_repeat and run again.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: offer hint/info when shared resources are used
data.body:
Sometimes is difficult to find a bug in the code just because it turns out all you had to do is make some resources unique. I like how blender offers info on how many times a certain resource is used and I think godot can benefit from something like this as well.

Example gotcha which isn't easy to detect: make an Area2D with CollisionShape2D and set the Shape parameter, Duplicate the Area2D and reuse it (say you have multiple objects that have the same Shape, but different scaling). Let's say we have 10 of these objects but 2 of them have are smaller, they still look the same so the Shape can work with them but it just needs to have different extents. We don't want to use scale here cause it might involve physics etc. (and if it isn't Area2D maybe it's Static2D, it's the same).

Problem is, if I make a script with an export var called scale_extents for example so that I can calculate different dimensions for Shape, then all of the Area2D nodes will be affected and it isn't easy to remember which resource is being reused.

A counter in the inspector on the property with reused resource would be nice, something like blender has perhaps

data.title: PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS Doesn't Inherit when Set From Code in Certain Situations
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 Stable, Win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I've got menus whose pause mode are adjusted in code. I have a Panel which has PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT by default, but is set to PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS in _ready(). It has an ItemList child which has PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT. Even though the code reports get_pause_mode() of then Panel as PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS from within the code, the ItemList acts as though paused. If I set the Panel to PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS in the editor, it behaves as it should.

The expectation is that any nodes with PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT that are immediate children of nodes with PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS should not behave as though they're paused.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a Panel, set it to PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT. Have its _ready() function call set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS). Give it an ItemList child with PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT, and add_item("Anything") to the ItemList.

Run the application and have it pause (possibly via a _ready() function). You will not be able to click on the ItemList item, even though it has PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT and its parent has PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS.

**Link to minimal example project**:
Here's an example demonstrating the difference between a parent with PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS set in the editor and PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS set in code.

![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10686700/19708168/7df38474-9ad1-11e6-828b-260d84dd64b8.png)

Both panels report a get_pause_mode() of 2 at runtime, but only the ItemList whose parent was set to PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS in the editor is selectable.

Here's the project example: 
[Example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/552010/Example.zip)

data.title: Improve drag and drop on 2D viewport
data.body:
Can make faster by dragging texture or Scene file onto 2D viewport.
And also working with live edit scene (Sync scene changes)

Drag & drop : Add node under selected node
Drag & drop + Shift : Add node as sibling with selected node
Drag & drop + Alt : Change default node type

[Preview on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEBr2zGnUcM)

data.title: Initial support for arm64-v8a
data.body: Signed-off-by: Anthony Fieroni bvbfan@abv.bg

data.title: Fix regression #6864 caused by #6613
data.body: Should fix the issue. Calling remove should delete all matching tweens but internally it stops on first match so should work with delayed tweens as before.

data.title: Add more file format for saving/loading data ?
data.body:
Currently we got the `File` class allowing [encrypted] binary saving and the `Dictionary` JSON methods. But why don't add more human friendly data format ? Like YAML ? Or add more used format like XML ?

The YAML can be very useful with game allowing simple modding. The YAML and the XML can also be used for debugging purpose.

It's just a proposal, and I know there are already an XMLParser, but not documented and doesn't allow writing XML data. Maybe also add an option for pretty-printing JSON ?

data.title: export triggers setter
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.10, Godot v2.1.official.stable

`export var a = 10 setget set_a` triggers setter, but `var a = 10 setget` doesn't. This might be logical from the implementation point of view but from a developer point of view it doesn't. An example why I don't like this. I'm trying to keep track of the player health in some singleton or with `Globals` when changing scenes so I do:

``` python

export var hp = 100 setget set_hp

func _ready():
    if Globals.has('player_hp'):
        self.hp = Globals.get('player_hp')

func set_hp(x):
    Globals.set('player_hp', x)
    hp = x
```

This doesn't work when using `export` like in the above example because the setter gets triggered when the node enters the scene so the `if` in `_ready` will always get triggered and resets the player hp to the default value. This is unwanted and if I'm not using `export` it works as expected.

So there's an inconsistency on how the setter is triggered between using and not using `export`.

data.title: Double-click project file to open it in Godot
data.body:
One of the usability problems that still remain is that it's a bit hard to open a project directly from the file explorer with Godot. You can open through command line or create a custom shortcut for each project, but it's cumbersome.

Since for 3.0 the project file will change name, might be a good opportunity to change this behavior.

**My proposal:**
- Change the `engine.cfg` to a file with custom extension, like `project.gdp` (`.gdp` for Godot Project, open to suggestions of course).
- Change the command line to accept a `.gdp` directly, without `-path` specifier (currently the expected argument is the starting scene path).
- Run the editor by default if it's a `tools=yes` binary.

This will allow the file to be associated with Godot and even be dragged & dropped over the Godot executable to open it. Also, it'll be possible to use a custom icon for Godot projects. It'll enable the recent file list on Windows, like my idea in #5653 and some other OS-specific possibilities.

data.title: Expose curve2D data on the inspector
data.body: I think it could be nice to have Curve2D data exposed on the inspector to fine tune points (position, in and out) values from there, that could allow to visually animate curves too.

data.title: Scene tree drag & drop node ends up as child
data.body:
This is a issue that have been brought up a few times before, and has supposedly been fixed, but i am still experiencing this problem. I am running Godot 2.1 stable on Ubuntu 16.04/Windows 8.

Trying to place a node under a node already with children, it ends up as a child instead of just being moved beneath.

This doesn't happen when moving a node next to a node without children.

Example from previous issue (#4628)
https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/15219243/06b74f30-1831-11e6-8e2a-f5db6e3542c4.gif

Previous issues stating this problem as reference:
#5341
#4628

data.title: Can't Play the Project (F5) when in full screen edit mode
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.11.6
Godot Version 2.1 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I am editing text in full screen mode (as in I press Command Shift F11) I can't just run the project by pressing F5.  I have to press CMD - SHIFT - F11 to exit full screen / edit mode and then press F5.  When done, I have to re-enter again with CMD - SHIFT - F11.  I'm getting quite good at this but it's a bit of a chore.

data.title: Change set_locale to fallback to the global language
data.body:
Addresses #6787 by adding a function to get the locale's language and attempt to use it as the locale before failing.

There is no test coverage for this new function or for the new functionality in set_locale. If needed, please let me know where to add it. Thanks!

data.title: Shader param won't reset after reloading scene with background loader
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Version compiled at 23-10-2016_00:44 (GMT+3) using Windows 7 (last commit as of now)
Operating system is Windows 7 64bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Description: 
Some animation made with shaders and Tween applied to a Sprite2D.
Creating a new instance from that scene and add it as a child to the root with a background loader (inside global.gd).
The parameter "material/material:shader_param/modulate" hangs from previous scene.

Expected:
Scene reload successfully with all parameters reset to the initial state.

Result:
Sprite2D loaded with previous scene params (material/material:shader_param/modulate)

**Steps to reproduce:**
With the provided project below:
1. Click on the play button.
2. Click on the button on the right [Animate].
3. Click on the button [Reload Scene].
4. Watch the animation "get stuck" on red color (do above steps several times)

When I free the scene before recreating it' it works ok.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B54uADD0Gcm9QmswZ0VJb05raXc

data.title: Updating a sound file makes the FileExplorer ignore display mode
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

![filesystem_display_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/19628548/9097122a-9960-11e6-8145-312433489396.png)

Repro steps:
1) Make sure the FileExplorer is in icons mode
2) Import a sound, see it in the FileSystem
3) Set the FileSystem display mode to "list"
4) Modify the sound and overwrite its file
5) Go back to Godot, see it auto-re-imports the updated sound
6) Notice the FileExplorer now shows an icon for the sound, making its line a lot bigger than others. It should not show an icon here because the selected mode is still "list".

Note: this issue probably affect other resource types.

Note 2: I noticed that hitting the "Play game" button, the UI refreshes and the FileExplorer shows the list correctly.

data.title: Godot keeps saving script at old location after being moved to another folder
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 official, Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:
1) Create a script
2) Save it as a file
3) Move the script to another folder (you can do it either from Godot or from the OS' explorer)
4) Go back to the script editor and save again
5) Notice the script was recreated at its old location, and the other was not updated

Godot is aware of the file being moved, because I can see the FileExplorer dock updates. But concerned resources aren't.

I feel this could have been issued already, but I cannot find it through the search.
